intro: Pterocarya stenoptera var. brevialata, commonly known as the short-leaved wingnut, is a deciduous tree native to China. It belongs to the Juglandaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated margins. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in catkins, followed by distinctive winged fruits that aid in seed dispersal. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in forested areas with well-drained soil. Its ornamental value and ecological importance make it a notable species in its native habitat.
